body_content.explanation: something that a copy can be based on because it is an extremely good example of its type:
examples: The educational system was a model for those of many other countries.
The developer plans to build a model community on the site.
They created an education system on the European model.
Even Chris, the very model of calmness (= someone who is usually extremely calm), was angered by having to work such long hours.
She really is a model (= perfect) student.

body_content.explanation: a person who wears clothes so that they can be photographed or shown to possible buyers, or a person who is employed to be photographed or painted:
examples: She's going out with a male model.
I worked as an artist's model when I was a college student.

body_content.explanation: a particular type of machine, especially a car, that is slightly different from machines of the same type:
examples: Luxury/New models come with laser devices that help guide the car into a parking spot.
Whether it's a computer, iPod or mobile phone, she always has to have the latest model.

body_content.explanation: a physical object, usually smaller than the real object, that is used to represent something:
examples: By looking at this model you can get a better idea of how the bridge will look.

body_content.explanation: a simple representation of a system or process that can be used in calculations or predictions of what might happen:
examples: No computer model of the economy can predict when the next recession will be.

body_content.explanation: to wear fashionable clothes, jewellery, etc. in order to advertise them:
examples: Tatjana is modelling a Versace design.
I used to model when I was younger.

body_content.explanation: to make a model of something:
examples: to model animals out of clay
to model clay into animal shapes
The whole car can be modelled on a computer before a single component is made.
